content: hot water bobble our basic hot water bottle pattern just got a makeover this simple and cozy cover is worked either in the round or flat from the bottom up it is fast to knit up no matter your skill level and is now covered in cute squishy bobbles yarn eva by great ocean road woollen mill 220m/100g or any 8ply/dk yarn quantity 1 skein or approximately 170-200m needles flat version 4 00mm and 3 50mm straight needles in the round - 4 00mm and 3 50mm 80cm circular needles gauge 22 stitches and 30 row to 10cm in stocking stitch materials yarn needle for sewing up 2 stitch markers for working in the round abbreviations sm slip marker k2tog knit two together sts stitches ssk slip slip knit k knit p2tog purl two together insert right needle into the p purl first and second stitches from right to left purl kfb knit front and back them both together mb make bobble in the next stitch knit into the front p2togtbl purl two together through the back loop insert leg of the stitch then the back then front then the right needle into the second and first stitches back turn purl 4 turn knit 4 then pass all from the back going left to right purl them both stitches over and off the left-most stitch on right together needle leaving 1 stitch 1 designed by emily bolduan © maker maker 2019 techniques top shaping work the following decreases and continue to keep - judy s magic cast on for working in the round pattern correct by lining up with previous bobbles at the - magic loop if working in the round edge only place a bobble if you have 2 or more stitches - mattress stitch between bobble and decrease - to use fold hot water bottle in half lengthwise and place inside cover before filling row 1 rs k2 k2tog work in pattern to last 4 sts ssk k2 two stitches decreased pattern flat row 2 ws p2 p2togtbl work in pattern to last 4 sts with 4mm needles cast on 37 sts p2tog p2 two stitches decreased next row ws purl to end repeat these two row 5 more times or until 23 sts working from chart a or written instructions below work remain increases as follows row 1 rs k1 kfb k to last 3 sts kfb k2 two stitches cuff increased change to smaller needles row 2 and following ws row purl to end set up row rs k1 k2tog p2 k2 repeat to end one row 3 as row 1 stitch decreased 22 sts row 5 as row 1 row 1 ws p2 k2 p2 repeat to end row 7 k1 kfb k3 mb k7 repeat to last 6 sts mb k2 kfb row 2 rs k2 p2 k2 repeat to end k2 two stitches increased and 5 bobbles made repeat these two row until ribbing measures 11-12cm row 9 as row 1 row 10
